intro: Ophiorrhiza ochroleuca, commonly known as the white-veined marsh plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with white petals and yellow stamens. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and along the edges of water bodies. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a distinct white venation pattern. Ophiorrhiza ochroleuca is adapted to waterlogged soils and plays a role in stabilizing mudflats and coastal areas.
